## R Markdown


```{r cars}
library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
library(labelled)
library(janitor)
library(pastecs)
library(haven)

w1_satisfaction_predictors <- haven::read_dta("Data-Stata/our_data/w1_pos_neg_yc_predictors.dta")
```

## Including Plots


```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
##CLEAN DATA HERE (E.G., GET RID OF NA'S WHEN YOU HAVE TIME; WILL HELP THE VISUALIZATIONS)

ggplot(aes(x = satisfaction), data = w1_satisfaction_predictors)+
  geom_histogram()

ggplot(aes(x = number_negative_incoming), data = w1_satisfaction_predictors)+
  geom_histogram()

ggplot(aes(x = number_outgoing_negative), data = w1_satisfaction_predictors)+
  geom_histogram()

ggplot(aes(x = satisfaction), data = w1_satisfaction_predictors)+
  geom_histogram()


```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
